DataElement.preferredName: Total Lung Capacity Test Specified Value
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the value in milliliters measuring the total volume of air normally contained in a patient's lungs.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the total lung capacity test.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Pertaining to an entirety or whole, also constituting the full quantity or extent; complete.:One of a pair of viscera occupying the pulmonary cavities of the thorax, the organs of respiration in which aeration of the blood takes place. As a rule, the right lung is slightly larger than the left and is divided into three lobes (an upper, a middle, and a lower or basal), while the left has but two lobes (an upper and a lower or basal). Each lung is irregularly conical in shape, presenting a blunt upper extremity (the apex), a concave base following the curve of the diaphragm, an outer convex surface (costal surface), an inner or mediastinal surface (mediastinal surface), a thin and sharp anterior border, and a thick and rounded posterior border. SYN pulmo.

Concepts.definition: Pertaining to an entirety or whole, also constituting the full quantity or extent; complete; derived by addition.

One of a pair of viscera occupying the pulmonary cavities of the thorax, the organs of respiration in which aeration of the blood takes place. As a rule, the right lung is slightly larger than the left and is divided into three lobes (an upper, a middle, and a lower or basal), while the left has two lobes (an upper and a lower or basal). Each lung is irregularly conical in shape, presenting a blunt upper extremity (the apex), a concave base following the curve of the diaphragm, an outer convex surface (costal surface), an inner or mediastinal surface (mediastinal surface), a thin and sharp anterior border, and a thick and rounded posterior border.

Property.preferredDefinition: The amount that can be contained.:A procedure for critical evaluation; a means of determining the presence, quality, or truth of something.

Concepts.definition: The amount that can be contained.  It can refer to the volume that can be held, such as lung capacity, or the number of people that can be contained in a room or building.
Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: information related to the specified value for lung capacity.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Value; a numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

Concepts.definition: A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Versioned to extend Max Length to 6 and add 2 Decimal Places for Duke per request by M.Leonard. mc 11/27/16

DataElement.changeDescription: Added Decimal Place for Duke per request by M.Leonard. mc 11/27/16
